title: Carousel
reference-overview: The Carousel control allows for a revolving display of different types of content by using a visual slideshow. It gives the user the ability to get an overview of important information at a quick glance by flipping quickly through the different slides.
reference-usage: The Carousel should be used when you want to convey different messages to the user in a single view. It's a useful control for displaying adjacent content, as the user can navigate between the slides.
reference-details:
• The Carousel can be displayed in 100% of the screen width when used in conjunction with the Hero Banner Layout.
  • The Carousel can be set to animate automatically without requiring any interaction from the user in order to progress through the slides.
  • The Carousel includes an optional navigational element that allows the user to control the slide to display.
  • The carousel cycles through images in a slideshow manner.
  • The Carousel can display images and/or high-level text messages.
  • The Carousel will often include the Call To Action control to provide navigatation to aspecific page.
  • The Carousel will typically have 3 to 5 slides to display information.
reference-mobile:
• The Carousel is fully responsive; large images will be scaled to fit.
  • Use caution with graphic and HTML text within the carousel as images will be reduced in size to fit the width of the mobile space. Graphic text may appear crunched and HTML text may wrap over important imagery.
reference-technical: The carousel is compatible will all current A and B grade browsers that Evolution currently supports.
